list-item.p: Mayaro fever virus is an alphavirus responsible for sporadic cases and several outbreaks of illness with fever, arthralgia, and rash in northern South America.
Some infected patients develop severe arthralgia during the defervescence period that can last up to a year.
Three Mayaro fever virus genotypes are recognized.
Mayaro fever virus is transmitted by Haemagogus mosquitoes, particularly H. janthinomys.
The main vertebrate hosts are non-human primates.
In the Brazilian Amazon, the specific antibody rate ranges from 5% to 60%; it is higher among closed communities (South American Indians) in the forests.
